title: Chennai Home Health Care (discover services + booking) — Frontend

requirements.summary: Implement core Chennai user flows: browse services, view service details, submit booking request, and view submitted bookings with confirmation UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can see a list of available home health care services for Chennai.
Users can open a service details view with clear information (service name, description, pricing, duration, coverage areas in Chennai, and what is included).
Users can submit a booking request with: selected service, patient name, phone, Chennai area/locality, preferred date/time, and notes.
After booking submission, the user sees a confirmation state and can view their submitted booking(s).

file_operations.description: Create the app shell + route wiring for Home, Services, Service Details, Booking, and My Bookings/confirmation states. Use shadcn-ui for consistent UI building blocks (e.g., buttons, inputs, cards) and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a shared layout with header navigation (Home, Services, My Bookings) and a consistent content container. Display the brand/logo area in the header. Use shadcn-ui primitives where appropriate and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create Chennai-focused landing content (English), featuring a short value proposition, key service categories, and prominent calls-to-action to browse services and book. Include hero illustration placement per REQ-5. Use shadcn-ui for layout/CTA elements and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a services browsing page that reads services via React Query and supports client-side search/filter (keyword, locality/area, optional category). Each service card links to Service Details. Use shadcn-ui inputs/selects/cards and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a service details page (reachable from the list) that loads a single service and presents clear info (name/description/pricing) plus UI sections for duration, coverage areas in Chennai, and what’s included (frontend-presented copy if not provided by backend). Provide a primary action to start a booking for this service. Use shadcn-ui components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the booking request form page with required fields (selected service, patient name, phone, Chennai area/locality, preferred date/time, notes). Validate required fields and block submission until valid. Submit using a React Query mutation and show success/error and a confirmation state on success. Use shadcn-ui form controls and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a page to list the current user’s submitted bookings using React Query, with empty/loading/error states and a link back to Services. Use shadcn-ui components for list presentation and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a thin frontend client wrapper around the existing backend interface (getServices, getService, requestBooking, getAllBookings/getUserBookings as appropriate) to keep React Query hooks clean. Prefer using the core-infrastructure component’s backend connection configuration and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Define React Query hooks for service list/details, booking submission mutation, and bookings list with consistent loading/error/success handling. Verify React Query integration patterns from the build-template-react setup before implementing.

Provide a small hook to access the current principal/identity (or stable anonymous identifier) for fetching ‘My Bookings’ when needed by the backend. Integrate with the existing InternetIdentityProvider wiring in main.tsx and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add and wire frontend pages for Home, Services (search/filter), Service Details, and Booking form; connect reads/writes using React Query with robust UI states.
acceptanceCriteria: Services list supports searching by keyword and filtering by Chennai area/locality (e.g., Adyar, T. Nagar, Velachery, Anna Nagar) and/or category.
Service Details page is reachable from the list and displays all key service info.
Booking form validates required fields and prevents submission until valid.
React Query handles loading, success, and error states for all reads/writes.

file_operations.description: Ensure search + locality filtering UX is present (preset Chennai localities), including clear reset controls and accessible input labels. Use shadcn-ui input/select components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the details page is reachable via routing, handles loading/error states, and includes a clear ‘Book this service’ action that carries the selected service into the booking form. Use shadcn-ui components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add form validation rules (required fields, basic phone format), disable submit until valid, and implement mutation-driven success/error UI. Use shadcn-ui form controls and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Implement consistent React Query keys, caching strategy for services, and mutation invalidation for bookings. Ensure all reads/writes expose loading/success/error to the UI.

Wire pages into navigation and routing so all created views are reachable (Home → Services → Service Details → Booking → Confirmation/My Bookings). Use shadcn-ui navigation primitives if applicable and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive healthcare marketplace theme (English-only UI text) using a non blue/purple-dominant palette and consistent typography/spacing across new pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The app has a consistent, polished theme (colors, typography, spacing) suitable for healthcare.
All user-facing text is in English.
Primary/secondary actions and form inputs have clear visual hierarchy and accessibility-friendly contrast.
Theme is applied consistently across all pages created in this build.

file_operations.description: Create global styling using Tailwind + shadcn-ui CSS variables (healthcare-appropriate warm neutrals/greens; avoid blue/purple-dominant primaries), set typography defaults, and ensure consistent spacing tokens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust theme tokens (if needed) to support the chosen non-blue/purple palette and consistent radii/shadows for a polished healthcare look; ensure compatibility with shadcn-ui token usage. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Apply theme-consistent header/footer styling, button hierarchy, and responsive layout patterns across navigation and shared sections. Use shadcn-ui components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure landing page copy, headings, and CTAs follow the new theme and remain English-only, with accessible contrast and clear hierarchy. Use shadcn-ui components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add generated logo and hero illustration assets under public and render them in the header/brand area and Home page hero section.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.
Home page displays the hero image and the app logo in the header/brand area.
Images are referenced via static paths and load correctly in production build.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static logo asset at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/hhc-chennai-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated static hero illustration at the exact path frontend/public/assets/generated/hhc-chennai-hero.dim_1600x900.png.

Render the logo image (frontend/public/assets/generated/hhc-chennai-logo.dim_512x512.png) in the header/brand area using a static public asset reference. Use shadcn-ui layout primitives as needed and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the hero illustration (frontend/public/assets/generated/hhc-chennai-hero.dim_1600x900.png) prominently in the Home hero section with appropriate alt text and responsive layout. Use shadcn-ui components and verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
